description: Attested since about 1720, from Latin vermis (“worm”) + fugāre (“to cause to flee”).

adjectives.description: vermifuge (comparative more vermifuge, superlative most vermifuge)

entries.meaning: (medicine, dated) Acting as a drug to cause expulsion or death of intestinal worms.
(medicine, dated) A drug that causes the expulsion or death of intestinal worms, such as tapeworms.
examples: We have been informed that the usual practice of Merchants, Farmers and Planters, in ordering their supplies of Dr. McLane's Celebrated VERMIFUGE, has been to simply write and order Vermifuge. The consequence is that instead of the genuine Dr. McLanes's Vermifuge, they very frequently get one or other of the many worthless preparations called Vermifuge now before the public.
